title: Last modified date before 1/1/1970 not preserved when uploading to pCloud
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I use rclone sync to upload photos to pCloud. Some of the photos have modification dates before 1/1/1970. 
These end up on pCloud with their mtime set to the current date/time. Judging from the pCloud API docs (https://docs.pcloud.com/methods/file/uploadfile.html), the API only allows Unix timestamps to be set, so I understand why this happens.
However, the pCloud App (on macOS in my case) is able to upload those files correctly. Obviously, they are using another API or something. Maybe it has something to do with using time.Time in api/types.go? I would be willing to help but unfortunately, I have no experience with go.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.57.0
- os/version: unknown
- os/kernel: 4.4.180+ (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.17.2
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```
#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Synology DS920+, uname -a prints
```
Linux Uther 4.4.180+ #42218 SMP Fri Sep 24 02:41:48 CST 2021 x86_64 GNU/Linux synology_geminilake_920+
```
#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
pCloud

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
rclone sync /volume2/photo/ pCloud:"My Pictures"/
```
#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
see comment above

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
